converter.title: Purchasing Power Parity Calculator
converter.description: Discover the real purchasing power of your dollars in different countries
converter.footer_tip: Data provided by AI analysis, for reference only
converter.empty_text: Enter an amount and select a country to start
converter.prompt:
As a Purchasing Power Parity (PPP) expert, please convert {amount} USD to the local currency of {country}.

Important: This is a PPP conversion, NOT an exchange rate conversion. Please calculate equivalent purchasing power based on real price levels and cost of living.

For example: The purchasing power of $100 in the US might be equivalent to 300 CNY in China (not the exchange rate of 720 CNY).

Please provide:
1. The equivalent amount based on purchasing power parity (not exchange rate)
2. Currency code (e.g., CNY, JPY, etc.)
3. 5 specific purchasing power comparison examples showing actual price differences for the same products in both countries

Please return in JSON format:
{
  "amount": "converted amount (number only)",
  "currency": "currency code",
  "comparisons": ["example1", "example2", "example3", "example4", "example5"]
}

Note: Return only the JSON, no other text

faq.title: Frequently asked questions
faq.description: Quick answers about the Rich Editor workflow.

items.question: Does Rich Editor support Markdown?
items.answer: You can export Markdown or HTML today. A dual-pane Markdown editor is on the roadmap.

items.question: Is real-time collaboration available?
items.answer: Not yet. The current release focuses on single-author workflows and versioning.

items.question: How does the AI assistant work?
items.answer: The editor ships with demo prompts now, and can be connected to real AI services later.

items.question: Where is my data stored?
items.answer: Drafts are saved locally in your browser for now. Cloud sync is planned for later releases.

faq.tip: Need more help? Reach out at support@shipany.com
